channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024030830
item.description:

DescribePack: 1 lid's cap on one of the buckets had popped open and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was moved to a HAZ tote in prep for processing.

PACKAGE DISCOVERED IN THE UNLOAD OFF TRAILER 570098 FROM 182-LEHI. DescribePack: NA DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: NA

item.title: Report X-2024031015
item.description:
Report X-2024031015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: PALATINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GOT A LEAKING PACKAGE FROM BAY 23 IN THE NORTHEAST PRIMARY. RESPONDER RETURNED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO THE DMP. IN THE DMP, OPENED THE BOX TO BEGIN WORKING ON THE LEAKING TO DISCOVER THE PRODUCT WITH A CORROSIVE DIAMOND LABEL ON IT. IMMEDIATELY STOPPED, AND NOTIFIED RMP, WHO IN TURN NOTIFIED THE CHSP. AFTER CALLING THE UNDECLARED HOTLINE, GOT PERMISSION TO PROCESS THE CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THE OUTSIDE CARTON HAD NO HAZMAT INDICATIONS ON IT. THE INTERIOR OF THE CARTON THE HAZMAT WAS IN A CLEAR PLASTIC BAG WITH ANOTHER ITEM, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, N.O.S. THERE WAS ONLY THREE AIR BAGS OF PACKING MATERIAL IN THE BOX AS WELL.

item.title: Report X-2024030923
item.description:
Report X-2024030923

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. UPON INSPECTION, INNER PAIL HAD BEEN SEVERELY DENTED NEAR TOP AND HAD LEAKED FROM LID. OUTER BOX ONLY HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND, AND NO HAZMAT PAPERWORK, BUT PRODUCT IS A FULLY-REGULATED FLAMMABLE IN THIS AMOUNT. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. DescribePack: INNER PAIL WAS SEVERELY DENTED NEAR TOP AND LEAKED FROM LID. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

item.title: Report E-2024030436
item.description:
Report E-2024030436

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLA experienced a UN3085 Kolene No. 5 release from a 500-pound supersack. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 pounds of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the wooden trailer floor and a 15’ x 2’ area of the concrete dock floor. The supersack was ripped due to improper loading. The material was transferred from the damaged sack into a 55-gallon poly drum for shipment on. All released product was placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged sack and pads were placed into a third 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024030437
item.description:
Report E-2024030437

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 14, 2024, approximately twenty (20) gallons of resin solution from a release at the previous terminal remained in the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the resin solution-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloading tralier 572543 from SCHG the package was discovered damaged/wet. THe package was put in a tote and taken to the haz mat cage for processing. DescribePack: Upon inspection there was no damage to the outer package such as puncture marks, holes, etc. THe lid on one of the gallon jugs was loose and had leaked about 3-4 ounces onto the paper inside of the package and a little on the outer package. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Pakage was placed in a tote and taken to the haz mat cage to be processed. There was no visible spill in the trailer.

DescribePack: There was no external damage to the outer packaging such as hole or crushed. The lid on the inner bottle was half way open and nothing keeping it from staying closed during transit. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: There was no spill aside from what was on the package and it was taken to the haz mat caged and processed.

item.title: Report E-2024030355
item.description:
Report E-2024030355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: WOODSTOCK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 11, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted floor and swept them in with hand tools. The one (1) damaged 55-gallon metal drum of paint was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum for further transport. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum for transport and further handling..

item.title: Report E-2024030307
item.description:
Report E-2024030307

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: EAST PEORIA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4in-by-4in area of the trailer floor and cardboard packaging and estimated that two (2) ounces of material was released due to a weld failure on one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Enviroserve personnel transferred the remaining product into two (2) 275-gallon poly tote and shipped on to the consignee. The released material was scrapped from the trailer floor and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail along with impacted cardboard from the other freight. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030316
item.description:
Report E-2024030316

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: EAST MOLINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-5ft area of the terminal concrete floor and estimated that one-hundred and thirty (130) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining product from the damaged tote along with rinse water that was used to neutralize two (2) 85-gallon metal drums that Dayton terminal personnel used to collect the leaking product in prior to the contractor’s arrival. The rinse water was offloaded into one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted flooring and collected the spent absorbents and containerized it along with impacted debris into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030136
item.description:
Report X-2024030136

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: Centreville
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024030136: Tank car releasing vapor from both vapor valves and liquid valve. All three valves in open position and plugs less than tool tight. Valves were closed and plugs tightened. X-2024030139: Liquid valve and A end vapor valve found with vapor release. Both valves in open position with plugs less than tool tight. Liquid valve plug had insufficient tape to properly secure plug. Both valves were closed. Liquid valve plug re-taped then both plugs tightened properly. X-2024030140: Liquid valve found releasing vapor past the plug. Valve in open position, plug had insufficient tape to secure and plug less than tool tight. Valve was closed, plug re-taped then plug tightened. X-2024030141: Odor of leaking car from ground. Inspection found liquid valve and A end vapor valves in open position with plugs less than tool tight. Both valves were closed and plugs tightened.
